name: The Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina

reviews.text: We just came back from our 4day trip to S.D. Our stay at the Sheraton was good. I checked in early to get a good view, but since we requested two adjoining rooms they could'nt accomodate us with a better view unless we separated (understandable). We stayed at the east tower. All the restaurants and the main pool are at the east tower, just nice. The pool side food is typical of hotel food pricey and not that great. The hotel has updated its look in some areas and some are desperatly asking for help like the arcade.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

likes.liked: — comfort for the price priceline 100 per night

reviews.title: Beware - Right next to the Airport
reviews.text: My sister stayed in the west tower. Rooms are renovated and seem larger. If your not traveling with family, stay there its more quiet. Overall we enjoyed our stay, Im not a big winer.

My husband and I and our two boys booked three nights at the hotel. Not being from San Diego, we did not realize that the hotel is across the street from the airport. We were awoken every morning at 6 am by the airplanes taking off. The hotel itself is lovely and comfortable, but Location, Location, Location. We ended up leaving early because we couldn't take the disruption anymore.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Nicer than expected
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton on our last leg down the coast for 3 nights. Had a deluxe room on the 9th floor with a great view. Room was large and comfortable, especially the beds. Bathroom was o.k.; clean, but could have been cleaner (tub). Air conditioning wasn't as cool as we would have liked it. We were able to regulate it ourselves, but it didn't feel that much cooler; but it was very quiet. We were in the West Tower, but ALL the action is in the East Tower. It is a pleasant 3 minute walk along the Marina. But after a few drinks, we had to walk ALL the way back. They have one restaurant in the West Tower. Had breakfast there one morning; it was our last. Poor service; ridiculous prices -- $4.50 for a glass of orange juice. We enjoyed the East Tower, especially Quinns (sports bar); good atmosphere. If we stay here again, we will request the East Tower (less walking). Found the desk staff at the West Tower friendly; helpful. Overall, this hotel is o.k. We would stay here again. It does sit next to the airport, but you truly are not disturbed by the air noise. In fact, between the hours of 11 p.m. and 6 a.m., the air traffic stops. We liked the location, and it really does have wonderful views.

My partner, son and I recently stayed at this Sheraton. As I fly often out of San Diego Airport, I often had seen this hotel which is located just across the street from the airport. From that distance, to be honest, it looks like a big 1960-ish (not too attractive) building. So, I must say that I had low expectations of the hotel when I decided to stay there. I thought it would just be a cold airport hotel where people would stay only for the convenience of the airport - not as a destination hotel. I am happy to write, however, that the hotel is much, much nicer when you are in it than how it had seemed from a distance! The service was very good (the valet parkers, the registration, bell-hops) and the views from the windows on the seventh floor were really beautiful. From one side you see the skyline of San Diego and from the other side you see the boats in the harbor/marina. The food there was also very good. My only complaint was that the overnight parking fee is quite high. We didn't hear any airplane noise, even though we were just minutes away from the airport. We just had the basic room, so that's what we got. It seemed like it had recently been renovated and was very clean and nice. The square footage seemed a little sparse (the room was kind of narrow shaped). Had a nice little balcony from which we could see the boats too! All in all, a fine place for a night or two.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from our San Diego vacation where we stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. After reading some of the previous reviews, I had mixed feelings going into this trip. However, once I arrived at the hotel, all my concerns quickly disappeared and our stay was completely enjoyable.
reviews.title: Had a great time at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina
Great view!
reviews.text: We stayed in the West Tower and even with 2 children (we had a king room with a rollaway and a crib) were were comfortable and had ample room. Our room faced the bay which was the best free entertainment. My 2 year old had a blast letting us know anytime a helicopter or airplane took off from North Island or a large ship was passing by. We could also see the Coronado Bridge, downtown San Diego and Point Loma from our balcony. We were also treated to fireworks being setoff near the bridge a couple of nights.

reviews.title: Great Location (surrounded by water)
reviews.text: The hotel has 3 lovely pools, a small one at the West Tower (with bar/food service), the larger "main" pool and another small pool at the East Tower. The "main" pool has poolside dining with waitstaff service. The food was good although typicaly priced for hotel food. It arrived quick, hot and with a smile from the server who checked on us frequently to make sure things were good. They also accomodated substitutions for the ingredients (ie: chicken for shrimp on the salad). They also allow (and sell) pool toys which was great for my kids. The walk from the West Tower to the East Tower was pleasant, with beautiful views of the harbor. There's a great little deli (Papanani's) along the way which was open for breakfast, lunch and dinner until 8pm. They serve the best tasting ice cream! Also, another poster stated there wasn't a game room/arcade as advertised but there is one, tucked away off the "main" pool, near the spa entrance.

The one downfall I found at this property was the $16 to self-park your car (you really need one, the hotel's not downtown or walking distance to public transportation) in the parking lot directly in front of the hotel. But. there are no other parking options available so as a hotel guest, you are stuck with the fee.
reviews.title: The WORST for the money!
Very nice
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel was comfortable, roomy and very accomodating to my family and we would definitely stay here in the future.

I stayed at the West tower for a business function and loved the intimacy. I did stroll over to the East tower and it was hopping! Beautiful lobby, bar, internet cafe, and restaurants. However, for me it was too busy. The airport is very close so be prepared for prompt 6:30am wake-up calls!
reviews.title: West tower, like a boutique hotel.

reviews.text: We also booked our reservation through Priceline and felt it was a good deal. The East Tower has a lot of energy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We could see part of the airport from our balcony but were not ever bothered by the noise, even with the patio door open. Excellent views of the harbor. No need to rent a car if you're comfortable with taxis - quick trip to the Gaslight Quarter. Nice pool.
reviews.title: Nice harbor views.

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Sheraton Marina April 18-April 20. Got the room thru priceline and
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: must agree that at $110, it was worth it. Read thru the preceeding threads and decided
reviews.title: Not bad at all, but make sure you book through Priceline

reviews.text: to book a room at the West Tower. The rooms are brand new and very, very large.
reviews.title: Outstanding customer service

reviews.text: We stayed here July 1 and 2, 2006 and had a great stay. We spoke to quite a few employees asking questions about renting bikes, restaurants, etc and everyone was very friendly and helpful. We even got lost downtown looking for a restaurant and I called the hotel for help ... the girl gave me directions and was really friendly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff!

reviews.text: We stayed in the West Tower, and I guess the rooms have been recently renovated (see pix). I thought the rooms were really large and you can see the ocean from bed (we had a bay view). The bathroom needed a bit of updating but the room itself was quite nice.
reviews.title: Nice place...worth the money

reviews.text: We ate at the Harbor's Edge which is in the East Tower and had a lovely lunch - service and food were good. The calamari was so yummy and tender! We spent our pool time at the West Tower pool though ... the East Tower pool was too crowded with too many kids for my taste. The West pool is more low-key although it also has a bar/food service counter.
reviews.title: Corporate hotel to a tee!!

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Harbor is beautiful
WATCH THOSE "LITTLE EXTRAS!"
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton during the 4th of July weekend. The rooms were nice, can't beat the view for the fireworks. Food was a little pricey but so is everything else in the area. Only do side if your not going to the harbor, you have to drive. Staff was very helpful. I would stay there again.

aka: The Sheraton San Diego Hotel And Marina
description: Nestled on the Bay, the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina offers panoramic views and easy access to the destination’s renowned attractions. The waterfront campus features 1,053 guest rooms with picturesque water views, as well as 73 meeting spaces, and 120,000 sq.ft. of indoor and outdoor event space. An award winning hotel, we specialize in group events ranging from 10 – 1,200 attendees. Enjoy authentic entertainment at San Diego’s illustrious waterfront attractions, Harbor Island and Liberty Station – a former Naval Base repurposed as a mix use destination. Experience the city’s waterfront attractions via The Big Bay Shuttle. The historic Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy and the amenities of downtown are only minutes away. Recreation includes a full service spa, two Core Performance Fitness Centers, three swimming pools, bicycle rentals, tennis and volleyball courts, as well as jogging/ bike trails connecting the hotel to the city’s majestic destination. Sail the Bay on one of our partner charter operators. Seasonal activities include Summer Play - an array of water recreation programs.
